primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human courtroom of 'retributive justice' to liberate the condemned through the 'restorative justice' of Christ's death and the Spirit's advocacy.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically through Christ and the Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has done what the law... could not do
he condemned sin in the flesh
The law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free
the power of God for salvation
the just requirement of the law might be fulfilled in us
the good commandments of God the Father

ontvanger.identificatie: Sinners (Murderers, Nicodemus, the 'Nice People' in the pews)
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly moved from 'Subject of their own morality' to 'Receiver of God's action'.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Spirit is called the Paraclete... lawyer for the defense
By the agency of the Spirit, there is a new creation
helper.rol_van_geest: External advocate who creates internal power.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Law of Sin and Death / Worldly Shame
tekstueel_bewijs: the law that condemns people and imprisons them without hope
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'law' that leads to 'death' and 'condemnation' at God's bar of judgment.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'New Man' living out the new life without shame in the face of worldly ridicule.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/witness) is strictly a result of the primary program (salvation). We walk in the Spirit because the Law was fulfilled *in* us by Christ.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → God in Christ ← Law of Sin/Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has done what the law... could not do
The Spirit blows where it wills
God does not weigh our merits
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You and I disobey the Ten Commandments
Nicodemus came to Jesus by night

voorbeelden: the just requirement of the law
somebody... does not want you to be a new person
once you catch on to it, it blasts you
once you get it you will never forget it
it is the power of God
enabled, by his grace, to move into and live the new life
being enabled even now to live according to the Spirit

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Dunamis) of God that achieves what human 'Devoir' (Must) failed to do. Grace is presented as the endowment of competence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Murderers/Guilt) to ~S1 (Nice people/Shame) to S1 (Christ's fulfillment).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the S2 (Condemnation) upon himself to move the Receiver to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon explicitly mentions execution, axe murders, and the 'law of death'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as 'unable' and 'condemned,' placing the agency of rescue entirely on God's 'restorative justice.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Paul could have remained rich... but something happened to him.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has done what the law... could not do.
the law of sin and death

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul and the prisoners are not models of effort, but trophies of grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already uses the theocentric reading: Paul was 'knocked from his horse' by Jesus.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'niceness' and the fear of condemnation.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'law that condemns' to the 'Spirit that gives life' is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'nice people' and 'new men'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the just requirement of the law is fulfilled for us

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'Lawyer' who provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) to live.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'law' that requires a death to break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: A textbook grace-oriented structure where God is the Subject of all redemptive verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a corrective to moralism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully uses the Actantial model to displace the 'Nice Person' as the subject of their own salvation, replacing them with the 'Advocate' who wins the case they could not.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Larry King anecdote; Greimas reveals the anecdote serves to define the 'Opponent' (Retributive Justice).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 8; Greimas shows how the sermon makes the hearer the 'Receiver' of Romans 8.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'Spirit as Lawyer' is not just a metaphor but a functional 'Helper' actant in the narrative of the Divine Courtroom.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Simul iustus et peccator' note to ensure the 'New Man' doesn't become a new moralistic Subject.
